TopicTitle: SpaceX CRS-3 Mission about to launch - 10 from posting GET READY!

Articles.Content:
Falcon 9 and Dragon are vertical on the launch pad in advance of todayÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s launch to the ISS. Launch is targeted for 3:25pm ET Ã¢â‚¬â€œ weather still a concern, watch here for updates!

The booster stage has a set of landing legs (folded) and after the stage separation , the booster will execute a burn to slow down, and the legs will deploy during the burn. The maneuver will end with a splashdown, not a full fledged landing, but is the first full size test of the reusable booster system.

WATCH HERE: http://new.livestream.com/spacex/events/2833937/statuses/48414686
The tower is retracting, I'm so excited!
Liftoff! Quick, someone find us a kickass soundtrack for this bad boy!
Is there a recording I can watch? Missed it =(

Congrats to SpaceX and Elon Musk for another successful Dragon launch, and the first (apparently) successful soft water landing of the Falcon first stage.
